intro: Eupatorium guadalupense var. wydlerianum, commonly known as Wydler's boneset, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, branching stems and clusters of small, white to pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall. This variant is distinguished by its unique morphological features and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
